title: The Art of French Pastry (gnv64)
description:
The Art of French Pastry 
by Jacquy Pfeiffer and Martha Rose Shulman
Knop | December 2013 | ISBN: 030795935X | 406 pages | ePUB | 16,5 MB

What does it take to perfect a flawless ÃƒÂ©clair? A delicate yet buttery croissant? To pipe dozens of macarons? The answer is: an intimate knowledge of the fundamentals of pastry. In The Art of French Pastry award-winning pastry chef Jacquy Pfeiffer, cofounder of the renowned French Pastry School in Chicago, gives you just that.
By teaching you how to make everything from pÃƒÂ¢te ÃƒÂ  choux to pastry cream, Pfeiffer builds on the basics until you have an understanding of the science behind the ingredients used, how they interact with one another, and what your hands have to do to transform them into pastry. This yields glorious results! Expect to master these techniques and then indulge in exquisite recipes, as well as some traditional Alsatian savory treats.
Pastry is all about precision, so Pfeiffer presents us with an amazing wealth of informationÃ¢â‚¬â€lists of necessary equipment, charts on how ingredients react in different environments, and the precise weight of ingredients in grams, with a look at their equivalent in U.S. unitsÃ¢â‚¬â€which will help you in all aspects of your cooking.
But in order to properly enjoy your Ã¢â‚¬Å“just desserts,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ so to speak; you will also learn where these delicacies originated. Jacquy Pfeiffer comes from a long line of pastry chefs and has been making these recipes since he was a child working in his fatherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s bakery in Alsace. Sprinkled with funny, charming memories from a lifetime in pastry, this book will have you fully appreciating the hundreds of years of tradition that shaped these recipes into the classics that we know and love, and can now serve to our friends and families over and over again.
The Art of French Pastry, full of gorgeous photography and PfeifferÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s accompanying illustrations, is a master class in pastry from a master teacher.
